snippet: The country’s foreign minister acknowledged for the first time on Tuesday that the Syrian government possesses chemical arms, while fighting continued around the country.
abstract: Syrian Foreign Min Walid Moallem acknowledges for first time that Syria's government possesses chemical arms and says country wants to become signatory to international convention banning chemical weapons; also suggests that Pres Bashar al-Assad is ready to accept deal advanced by Russia to put weapons under international supervision to avoid threatened American military strike.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The country’s foreign minister acknowledged for the first time on Tuesday that the Syrian government possesses chemical arms, while fighting continued around the country.

headline.main: In Shift, Syrian Official Admits Government Has Chemical Arms
headline.print_headline: In Shift, Syrian Official Admits Government Has Chemical Arms
